questions.quest: Which of the following JavaScript commands tells a browser to open a dialog box with a message?

The process of combining one or more strings is called:
Which of the following tells a browser to open a dialog box for collecting a response with the message 'Type your name' in it?
Which of the following JavaScript methods takes a string and tries to convert it to an integer (a whole number)?
How do you round the number 7.25, to the nearest integer?
How would you 'call a function' named sayHello?
choices: Type function, a set of parentheses and the name of the function: function(sayHello);
Type the name of the function followed by parentheses: sayHello();
Type run followed by the function name:Â run sayHello();
Type the name of the function followed by a semicolon: sayHello;
questions.correct: Type the name of the function followed by parentheses: sayHello();

questions.quest: What does the JavaScript return statement do?
choices: 'return' sends a value back to the program and continues running the rest of the code in the function.
'return' exits a function and sends a value back to the spot in the program where the function was called
'return' provides a way to send information to a function
questions.correct: 'return' exits a function and sends a value back to the spot in the program where the function was called

questions.quest: What is 'scope' in JavaScript?
choices: Scope is the way you give and get information from functions
Scope is the list of functions in the currently running program
Scope is used to determine when a function returns a value
Scope is the context in which a variable can be accessed, such as within a function, or within the global scope of the entire program
questions.correct: Scope is the context in which a variable can be accessed, such as within a function, or within the global scope of the entire program
